description: Export balls to geometry sets for post-processing or STL export. If no range is specified, all balls in the model are exported. Currently only supports export to geometry sets.

geometry_keywords.name: set
geometry_keywords.description: Geometry set base name (default: 'balls'). With 'split', creates sets named '<s>_ball<id>'

geometry_keywords.name: resolution
geometry_keywords.description: Facet edge resolution factor. Edge length < f * R where R is ball radius (default: 0.25)

geometry_keywords.name: split
geometry_keywords.description: Export each ball to dedicated geometry set (default: all balls in one set)

geometry_keywords.name: positions
geometry_keywords.description: Create only geometry nodes from ball positions (no triangulated surfaces)

examples.description: Export all balls as triangulated geometry to set 'balls' with default resolution 0.25
Export balls with higher resolution (0.1) to geometry set 'my_balls'
Export each ball to separate geometry set (e.g., 'ball_group_ball1', 'ball_group_ball2')

examples.command: ball export geometry positions range group 'layer1'
examples.description: Export only ball center positions as geometry nodes for balls in 'layer1' group

examples.command: ball export geometry resolution 0.5 range id 1 100
examples.description: Export balls 1-100 with lower resolution (coarser triangulation)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('ball export geometry ...') - no Python SDK equivalent for geometry export
